titleInfo.title: Letter from Nicholas Hankey Smith, Bushire to Jonathan Duncan, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has particularly affected the second folio. As a result some the text towards the end of the letter has been obscured, along with much of the author's signature.

mods.abstract: The letter provides information on a loan issued by the Resident to Mahomed Hossain Khan, son of the late Navob Mehady Ali Khan [Mahdī ‘Alī Khān], so that he and his mother may make a pilgrimage to the tomb of Emam Reza [Imam Reza] at Meshed [Mashhad] in Korrasoon. It further provides instructions that the debtor's savings, deposited with the company at Bombay, are to be used as security.
